member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector
member.summary: Provides a way to choose a DataTemplate based on the data object and the data-bound element.

remarks.para: Typically, you create a DataTemplateSelector when you have more than one DataTemplate for the same type of objects and you want to supply your own logic to choose a DataTemplate to apply based on the properties of each data object.

To create a template selector, create a class that inherits from DataTemplateSelector and override the SelectTemplate method. Once your class is defined you can assign an instance of the class to the template selector property of your element.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode
member.summary: Describes the placement of where a Popup control appears on the screen.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Absolute
member.summary: A position of the Popup control relative to the upper-left corner of the screen and at an offset that is defined by the HorizontalOffset and VerticalOffset property values. If the screen edge obscures the Popup, the control then repositions itself to align with the edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: A position of the Popup control where the control aligns its upper edge with the lower edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the PlacementTarget. If the lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its lower edge aligns with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget. If the upper screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control then repositions itself so that its upper edge aligns with the upper screen-edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Center
member.summary: A position of the Popup control where it is centered over the PlacementTarget. If a screen edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Right
member.summary: A position of the Popup control that aligns its left edge with the right edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget. If the right screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its left edge aligns with the left edge of the PlacementTarget. If the left screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its left edge aligns with the left screen-edge. If the upper or lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control then repositions itself to align with the obscuring screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Left
member.summary: A Popup control that aligns its right edge with the left edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget. If the left screen-edge obscures the Popup, the Popup repositions itself so that its left edge aligns with the right edge of the PlacementTarget. If the right screen-edge obscures the Popup, the right edge of the control aligns with the right screen-edge. If the upper or lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself to align with the obscuring screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Top
member.summary: A position of the Popup control that aligns its lower edge with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the PlacementTarget. If the upper screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its upper edge aligns with the lower edge of the PlacementTarget. If the lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the lower edge of the control aligns with the lower screen-edge. If the left or right screen-edge obscures the Popup, it then repositions itself to align with the obscuring screen.

member.value: The difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest value of a specified selection.
member.remarks: The value of the SelectionEnd property cannot be greater than the value of the Maximum property and cannot be less than the value of the Minimum property. The value of the SelectionEnd property must also be greater than or equal to the value of the SelectionStart property. If the value of the SelectionEnd property is greater than the value of the Maximum property or less than the value of the Minimum property, the value is set to the value of the Maximum or Minimum property respectively.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" TickFrequency="1" IsSelectionRangeEnabled="True" SelectionEnd="8" SelectionStart="6"/>

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest value of a specified selection.
member.remarks: IsSelectionRangeEnabled must be True in order to use SelectionStart and SelectionEnd The value of the SelectionStart property cannot be less than the value of the Minimum property and cannot be greater than the value of the Maximum property. The value of the SelectionEnd property must also be greater than or equal to the value of the SelectionStart property. If SelectionStart is less than Minimum or greater than Maximum, SelectionStart is set to the value of Minimum or Maximum respectively.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" TickFrequency="1" IsSelectionRangeEnabled="True" SelectionEnd="8" SelectionStart="6"/>

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the Delay property of the Increase and Decrease handles.
member.remarks: Each click on any of the handles increases/decreases the value by the amount that is set to the SmallChange property.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Delay="100" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.HandlesVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the Visibility property of the Increase and Decrease handles.
member.remarks: Each click on any of the handles increases/decreases the value by the amount that is set to the SmallChange property.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" HandlesVisibility="Visible" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.RepeatInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the RepeatInterval property of the Increase and Decrease handles.
member.remarks: Each click on any of the handles increases/decreases the value by the amount that is set to the SmallChange property.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" RepeatInterval="100" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsDirectionReversed
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of increasing value. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
The value of this property determines the direction of increasing value of a RadRadSlider.
For example, when you move the thumb control up on a vertical RadSlider when the IsDirectionReversed property is set to false, the Value of the RadSlider increases. If the value of the IsDirectionReversed property is changed to true, the Value of the RadSlider decreases as the thumb moves up.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" IsDirectionReversed="True" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsMoveToPointEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the thumb of a RadSlider moves immediately to the location of the mouse click that occurs while the mouse pointer pauses on the RadSlider track. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: When this property is set to false and a mouse click occurs along the RadSlider away from the thumb, the thumb moves in the direction of the mouse click. Instead of moving immediately to the mouse click location, the thumb moves a distance that is defined by the RepeatInterval property for each mouse click. The effect of multiple mouse clicks can be emulated by pressing and holding the left mouse button until the thumb is repositioned to the desired location.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" IsMoveToPointEnabled="True" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsSelectionRangeEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the RadSlider can displays a selection range. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: The SelectionStart and SelectionEnd properties define a selection range and must be set for the selection range to appear when IsSelectionRangeEnabled is set to true.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" IsSelectionRangeEnabled="True" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsSnapToTickEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the RadSlider automatically moves the thumb to the closest tick mark. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: When the position of a thumb is changed and the IsSnapToTickEnabled property is set to true, the thumb is automatically moved to the closest tick mark.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" IsSnapToTickEnabled="True" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of a RadSlider. This is a dependency property.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Height="100" Orientation="Vertical" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsMouseWheelEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the wheel of the mouse can be used for sliding the thumb. This is dependency property.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" IsMouseWheelEnabled="True" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between tick marks. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: If the Ticks property is set to a value that is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the TickFrequency property is not used.T The TickPlacement property must be set to a value other than None for tick marks to appear along the RadSlider. Tick marks are drawn at an interval that is specified by the TickFrequency property. The tick marks start at the value of the Minimum property and continue until the value of the Maximum property is reached.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" TickFrequency="1" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of tick marks with respect to the track of the RadSlider. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: The TickPlacement property must be set to a value other than None for tick marks to appear.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" TickFrequency="1" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.Ticks
member.summary: Gets or sets the positions of the tick marks to display for a RadSlider. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: Tick marks that are outside the range that is defined by the Minimum and Maximum property values are ignored. The TickPlacement property must be set to a value other than None for tick marks to appear.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" Ticks="3,5,8" IsMoveToPointEnabled="True" />

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the TickTemplate that will be used to represent a single tick on the TickBar.

remarks.para: Order of precedence (from highest to lowest): 1. TickTemplate 2. TickTemplateSelector 3. Default tick template

example.code: <UserControl.Resources> <DataTemplate Key="tickTemplate"> <Grid> <TextBlock Text="{Binding}" /> </Grid> </DataTemplate> </UserControl.Resources> <Grid x:Name="LayoutRoot"> <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" TickTemplate="{StaticResource tickTemplate}" TickFrequency="0.1" TickPlacement="Both"/> </Grid>

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickTemplateSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the TickTemplateSelector that will be used to pick a template for the tick marks.

remarks.para: Order of precedence (from highest to lowest): 1. TickTemplate 2. TickTemplateSelector 3. Default tick template

example.code: <UserControl.Resources> <DataTemplate Key="template_1"> <Grid> <!-- Content of the template 1 goes here! --> </Grid> </DataTemplate> <DataTemplate Key="template_2"> <Grid> <!-- Content of the template 2 goes here! --> </Grid> </DataTemplate> <DataTemplate Key="template_3"> <Grid> <!-- Content of the template 3 goes here! --> </Grid> </DataTemplate> </UserControl.Resources>

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsFocused
member.summary: Gets whether the RadSlider control is focused. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The IsFocused property idicates whether the control has focus. If the slider is focused, one can use the keyboard to change its value.
The IsFocused property is Read-only, to move the focus to an element, use the method.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.EnableSideTicks
